Source   Edit  

Frequency effects and control.

This module handles all frequency effects and related procedures regarding channel frequency.

This module is part of the inner workings of the engine module, and has an unstable API.

Imports

../ir, ../notes

Types

Arpeggio = object

Arpeggio modulator.

Similates a chord by alternating between three notes each tick. Enable by calling setParam with a nonzero parameter, then set the chord buffer via setChord. The modulator can be stepped by calling tick, which returns the frequency for that tick.

Source   Edit   
FrequencyControl = object
Handles frequency calculation for a channel. For each tick, call tick on this control to get the frequency. If the channel has an operation, set it first via setOperation. Source   Edit   
NoteResolver = object
  maxFrequency*: uint16
  maxNote*: uint8
Resolves a note value to a frequency value
  • isTone: Determines if tone notes are expected
  • maxFrequency: Highest frequency value possible.
  • maxNote: Highest note value possible.
Source   Edit   
Slide = object

Frequency slide modulator.

Modulates a frequency by sliding amount units towards the target frequency. To use set the desired amount and target, then call tick which will modify the given frequency.

Source   Edit   
Vibrato = object
  delay*: uint8

Square vibrato generator.

Generates a frequency offset that can be added to an existing frequency to give it a vibrato effect. This effect oscillates periodically between a negative extent and a positive extent every period frames.

To use set the period and extent via setParam, and optionally set the delay. Then to start generation, call trigger and then call tick to get the current offset.

Source   Edit  

Consts

noiseResolver = (kind: noise, maxFrequency: 59'u, maxNote: 59'u)
Default resolver for noise notes. Source   Edit   
toneResolver = (kind: tone, maxFrequency: 2047'u, maxNote: 83'u)
Default resolver for tone notes. Source   Edit

proc setChord(a: var Arpeggio; resolver: NoteResolver; baseNote: uint8) {.
    ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Sets the chord buffer for the arpeggio for the given base note. Source   Edit   
proc setOperation(fc: var FrequencyControl; op: Operation) {....raises: [],
    tags: [], forbids: [].}

Sets an operation on this control, which will update the current note, frequency modulator, vibrato and others as needed.

Call this before tick for changes to effect that tick.

Source   Edit   
proc setParam(a: var Arpeggio; effectParam: uint8) {....raises: [], tags: [],
    forbids: [].}
Set the parameters of the arpeggio. The upper nibble of the parameter contains the semitone offset from the base note for the second note in the chord. The lower nibble contains the offset for the third note. If both offsets are 0 (effectParam = 0), then the arpeggio is disabled. Source   Edit   
proc setParam(v: var Vibrato; effectParam: uint8) {....raises: [], tags: [],
    forbids: [].}
Set the parameters of the vibrato. The upper nibble of the parameter is the period, or the number of ticks per oscillation. The lower nibble is the extent, or magnitude of the offset amount. An extent of 0 will disable the vibrato. Source   Edit   
proc tick(a: var Arpeggio): uint16 {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Ticks the arpeggio 1 frame, the next frequency in the chord is returned. Source   Edit   
proc tick(fc: var FrequencyControl; arpIn, pitchIn: Option[uint8]): uint16 {.
    ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}

Step the control for 1 tick, with the given arpeggio and pitch sequence inputs. The calculated frequency for this tick is returned.

arpIn and pitchIn should be the current values of an instrument's arpeggio and pitch sequences, if present. The control's modulator will be ignored if arpIn is provided, as that frequency will be used instead.

Source   Edit   
proc tick(s: Slide; freq: var uint16): bool {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}

Ticks the slide 1 frame, by moving freq towards the slide's target. freq is left unchanged if it is already at the target.

true is returned if freq is at the target.

Source   Edit   
proc tick(v: var Vibrato): int {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Calculates the next offset value for the current tick. 0 is returned if the vibrato is disabled. Source   Edit   
proc trigger(v: var Vibrato) {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Triggers or restarts the vibrato generator for a new note starting. Source   Edit   
func tune(fc: FrequencyControl): int8 {.inline, ...raises: [], tags: [],
                                        forbids: [].}
Gets the current tune offset of the control. Source   Edit   
func tuneValue(param: uint8): int8 {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Calculate a tuning offset from the given effect parameter. The parameter has a bias of 0x80 so this function removes that bias in the return value.
  • 0x80 is 0, resulting frequency is kept as is.
  • 0x81 is 1, resulting frequency is added by 1 unit.
  • 0x7F is -1, resulting frequency is subtracted by 1 unit.
Source   Edit
